page.title: 08The Methodist Chapel
page.content: A Methodist Sciety was formed here around l820, but the church building was dedicated in October l850. There are services every Sunday afternoon, with Sunday School in the morning. The membership is very small: average attendance is six, with a Minister or local preacher from the Dorchester Circuit. The building is registered for marriages. It is a very plain and simple building with seating for ninety. Music is provided by a harmonium-type organ which has seen better days, but as true Methodists singing goes well. The highlight of the year is Harvest Festival, with the church beautifully decorated with home grown fruit, flowers and vegetables. Once a year members of the Parish and Congregational Churches come to Bere Heath for a combined service. At Christmas members go carol singing.
